function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Impact of cancelled field trips, meetings, and networking opportunities on conservation biases","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Loss of in-person engagement mechanisms leading to decline in community trust and participation","category":"Social Expression","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for holistic approaches to address zoonotic transmission and biodiversity loss","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Less urgent tasks such as research projects and long-term monitoring are deprioritized during the pandemic, leading to gaps in data and understanding of conservation needs","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased hunting pressure and shifts in trading patterns leading to enhanced trading of endangered species","category":"Wildlife","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on livelihoods and food security leading to increased exploitation of wildlife and habitats","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disturbances and reduction in protection efforts leading to illegal trafficking of wildlife","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on community engagement events and fundraising for conservation projects","category":"Arts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of non-covid-19 perturbations on conservation outcomes","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex conservation outcomes of non-covid-19 perturbations","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unverified anticipated outcomes may lead to inaccurate conclusions","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The focus on perturbations with major social, political, economic, and/or ecological impacts may include contagious diseases like COVID-19","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Postponement or cancellation of research, monitoring, and training/education programs in the conservation sector due to global reduction in mobility","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid spread of contagious diseases, such as COVID-19, impacting global society","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerabilities in social and economic models supporting conservation efforts","category":"Wealth production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited empirical work on covid-19 and entrepreneurship","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Supply chain vulnerability due to reliance on suppliers from countries with more covid-19 cases","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Behavioral changes due to the covid-19 crisis affecting entrepreneurship","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate empirical research on the impact of policy responses on sme resilience and entrepreneurial capacity","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resilience of smes is interconnected with the resilience of their ecosystems, making them dependent on external factors.","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of resilience in the entrepreneurial ecosystem","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pivoting business operations to selling face masks may lead to increased physical interaction and potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changed consumer behavior","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Behavioral changes due to the crisis","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of the virus due to economic instability and behavioral changes leading to cultural and lifestyle changes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data uncertainties leading to inaccurate transmission models","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of movement dynamics and demographics","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in risk predictions due to limited training data and unknown spatial differences in treatment seeking rates.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of information on receptivity to imported cases due to outdated prevalence data and changes in population dynamics.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of travel histories in case data raising the possibility of infections acquired away from the location of residence.","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exportation of parasites to other locations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cross-border movement rate quantification","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Infection importations from neighboring countries","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Over-reliance on mass drug administration mda or mass screen and treat msat approach","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of post-elimination surveillance targeting","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rising parasite carriage by human travellers","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in quantifying and understanding human movement patterns","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of human mobility on the spatial impact of interventions","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heterogeneous pattern of impact targeting surveillance and control","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population movements leading to larger exporters of infections","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of human mobility on spatial impact of interventions","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High mobility leading to increased spread of contagious diseases like malaria","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in movement patterns impacting regional spread of contagious diseases","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intervention in high-mobility areas can substantially reduce disease impact","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differing sets of communities of strongly connected areas found in weighted networks of movements.","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial differences between returning residents and visitors in community membership.","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stronger levels of internal connectivity through movements within the same communities.","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Seasonal movement rates increase just before the main malaria transmission season, leading to potential spread of malaria.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial heterogeneities in movement patterns and predicted malaria risk lead to variations in relative rates of infection movements, contributing to malaria spread.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High movement rates drive parasite flows across the region, creating areas that are simultaneously both major sources and sinks of parasites.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
